Posts.Content: Hi Emm,                     You must be at the same stage as me I had a right mastectomy and sentinal node biopsy. I have had to have help with things like washing my hair and some housework. My biggest problem is my arm just above the elbow on the inside it is like a painful tingling sensation. Have you had this?  As you have said I have had more movement than expected especially as I am right handed I had my original dressing removed on Wednesday, but the nurse replaced it with another which she gave me more dressings to be able to change. I have a hospital appointment on Tuesday for the results. When is your next appointment   Best wishes Christine
Posts.Title: Mastectomy after care

Posts.Content: I am 69 years old and i was diagnosed with breast cancer in 2012, i have had another appointment sent for a yearly mammogram, do i need it. I have been reading that too much radiation can start cancer. Has anyone any thoughts on this which would help me decide yes or no.
Posts.Title: Mammograms are they needed every year

Posts.Content: Please do not feel alone just ask as many questions as you like someone here will have been through the same thing.  I did not go to a support group i had one to one support from breast cancer care who phoned me up and helped me so much, i remember how terrified and angry i was when i was first told the news.  If you would like to get in touch with breast cancer care i have copied the website below.   You could also call the Macmillan support line who are very helpful.   http://www.breastcancercare.org.uk/breast-cancer-services/someone-talk/one-one-support
Posts.Title: feel alone

Posts.Content: Hi,          Many thanks for all your replies I did have a thought that the one by the scar may be a seroma. The swelling on my arm seems to be a little better if I massage with moisturising lotion.   Best wishes to everyone Christine
Posts.Title: Help Needed

Posts.Content: I had a mastectomy in January and I  now have a swelling at the end of the scar and just above the elbow on the inside of the arm.  It has been more noticeable since the warmer weather here in the u.k.   I can not speak to my breast care nurse until Monday but when I spoke about a small swelling to her she said unless it felt hard they would not do anything/   I would be glad of any advice.   Best wishes Christine
Posts.Title: Help Needed

Posts.Content: Many thanks I hope to be able to speak to the breast care nurse on Monday I find it very hard to speak to them. They have an answerphone and after leaving a message it was 3 days before I spoke to them last time. I am finding it very uncomfortable in this heat.   Best wishes Christine.
Posts.Title: Help Needed

Posts.Content: I managed to get in to see the breast care nurse she would not drain the swelling as it was soft swelling she said and could be caused by the hot weather. Without mentioning the word lymphoedema she said she could measure up for a compression sleeve. I have decided to wait to see it goes down on its own first. Anyone know if there is an alternative to wearing a compression sleeve. It is a little uncomfortable at times but it is bearable, not a lot of pain   Best wishes Christine
Posts.Title: Help Needed

Posts.Content: Hi,           I am a little younger than you being 64 years old. I have been taking Anastrozole for about two and a half months and have not had any side affects.         If you do decide to take them eat a bowl of cereal or something before taking as this I think has kept away the my sickness . I have had the odd ache and pain but I put this down to age. Best wishes Christine
Posts.Title: Anastrozole - to take or not?

Posts.Content: Hi,         I had oestrogen receptor cancer hope this helps. Do remember when making up your mind that everyone is different when it comes to side effects of any drug. Best wishes Christine
Posts.Title: Anastrozole - to take or not?

Posts.Content: I had a single mastectomy 4 years ago and did not want to go for reconstruction so have been wearing a prosthesis ever since. Looking back i wish i could have had the option of a double mastectomy then everything would have been flat without the worry of does the one look bigger than the other.  I am only a c cup so i do not wear one in bed but it feels so strange after wearing it all day.
Posts.Title: is double mastectomy easier than prosthesis 24/7

Posts.Content: Love to hear about how you get on any idea if there is a course in the West Midlands any where. How long after surviving are you allowed to go on one of these courses. Chris
Posts.Title: A few tips from my Cancer Survivorship Course

Posts.Content: I had a right mastectomy 5 years ago and decided not to go for reconstruction due to the fluid problem. I have been wearing a prosthesis  but it just does not look right. What do you use to pin the knitted knocker to your bra. I have been using genie bras with the pocket to put the prosthesis in but it is difficult to make it look the same size as the left.
Posts.Title: Mastectomy Bras!

Posts.Content: Thank you very much i will have to try this
Posts.Title: Mastectomy Bras!

Posts.Content: Hi, I am on Arumidex which I hqve been on for about 2 months now. When I first started taking it I felt tired and had headaches but they have settled down now. I had to have a lot less treatment than you I just had a mastectomy and SNB without all the chemo and radiotherapy. I had the op in January but i still feel a l pulling from the scar tissue when I do the exercises and numbness in the top of my arm. Did you have any problems like that? Christine xxx
Posts.Title: Amiridex

Posts.Content: Hi,        Many thanks for your reply I am glad someone else is feeling the same I kept thinking something was wrong, Something I did not say in my earlier email about Amidex is I have a bowl of cereal in a morning before taking as it is likely to cause you to feel sick without food. Let me know how you get on Christine xxx
Posts.Title: Amiridex
